com.nkoiv.mists.game.gameobject

Class MapObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nkoiv.mists.game.gameobject.MapObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Global
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Creature, Effect, Structure

    public class MapObject
extends Object
implements Global
    MapObjects are basically anything that can be encountered on in a Location (dungeon/town/whatever) This generic class is meant for things that don't fit in various subclasses. MapObject is extended by, for example, PlayerCharacter, Creatures, SpellEffects, etc. Unlike a mere Sprite (which it heavily utilizes), MapObject is tied to a certain Location.
    Author:
    nkoiv

      • setFlag

        public void setFlag(String flag,
                    int value)
        Flags store any soft information for the object
        Parameters:
        flag - The name of the flag
        value - Value for the flag (0 or less is not flagged)

      • toggleFlag

        public void toggleFlag(String flag)
        Toggle flag on or off. If Flag was more than 0, it's now 0. If it was less or equal to 0 or didnt exist, it's now 1
        Parameters:
        flag - Flag to toggle

      • getFlag

        public int getFlag(String flag)
        Return the value for the given flag
        Parameters:
        flag - Desired flag
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the flag

      • isFlagged

        public boolean isFlagged(String flag)
        Check if the MapObject has the given flag
        Parameters:
        flag - Flag to check
        Returns:
        returns true if MapObject has given flag at more than 0

      • setCenterPosition

        public void setCenterPosition(double xPos,
                              double yPos)
        Sets the (sprite) position so that the center of the sprite (instead of top left corner) is at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        xPos - Center position of the sprite on X
        yPos - Center position of the sprite on Y

      • render

        public void render(double xOffset,
                   double yOffset,
                   javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        Render draws the Sprite of the MapObject on a given GraphicsContext
        Parameters:
        gc - GraphicsContext where the object is drawn
        xOffset - Used to shift the objects xCoordinate so its drawn where the screen is
        yOffset - Used to shift the objects yCoordinate so its drawn where the screen is
